alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 17 at 7:13PM MDT until May 17 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT/845 PM CDT/ FOR EAST CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO AND WEST CENTRAL CHEYENNE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 713 PM MDT/813 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles south of Wray, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Vernon and Beecher Island. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 224 and 239. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
